Package soot.jimple.infoflow.handlers

Class SequentialTaintPropagationHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • soot.jimple.infoflow.handlers.SequentialTaintPropagationHandler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    TaintPropagationHandler
    public class SequentialTaintPropagationHandler
extends Object
implements TaintPropagationHandler
    Taint propagation handler that processes a sequence of inner handlers. For outputs, all generated abstractions are merged into a final abstraction set.
    Author:
    Steven Arzt

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface soot.jimple.infoflow.handlers.TaintPropagationHandler

        public void notifyFlowIn​(soot.Unit stmt,
                         Abstraction taint,
                         InfoflowManager manager,
                         TaintPropagationHandler.FlowFunctionType type)
        Description copied from interface: TaintPropagationHandler
        Handler function that is invoked when a taint is proagated in the data flow engine
        Specified by:
        notifyFlowIn in interface TaintPropagationHandler
        Parameters:
        stmt - The statement over which the taint is propagated
        taint - The taint being propagated
        manager - The manager object that gives access to the data flow engine
        type - The type of data flow edge being processed

      • notifyFlowOut

        public Set<Abstraction> notifyFlowOut​(soot.Unit stmt,
                                      Abstraction d1,
                                      Abstraction incoming,
                                      Set<Abstraction> outgoing,
                                      InfoflowManager manager,
                                      TaintPropagationHandler.FlowFunctionType type)
        Description copied from interface: TaintPropagationHandler
        Handler function that is invoked when a new taint is generated in the data flow engine
        Specified by:
        notifyFlowOut in interface TaintPropagationHandler
        Parameters:
        stmt - The statement over which the taint is propagated
        d1 - The abstraction at the beginning of the current method
        incoming - The original abstraction from which the outgoing ones were computed
        outgoing - The set of taints being propagated
        manager - The manager object that gives access to the data flow engine
        type - The type of data flow edge being processed
        Returns:
        The new abstractions to be propagated on. If you do not want to change the normal propagation behavior, just return the value of the "taints" parameter as-is.

        Adds all of the given taint propagation handlers

        handlers - The taint propagation handlers to add
